page.title: 07Beating the Bounds Chailey
page.content: Every year at the end of May, there is race around Chailey to commemorae the old custom of Bealing the Bounds. The race is a relay and the teams leave at one minute intervals. The first part of the relay is running. the runners go through the grounds of the school and touch the railings by the road. This is the signal for the cyclists to start. After the cyclists there are horses and riders, ladies and their dogs, canoeists obstacle sections and others. Teams from all around the area enter the race which takes all morning to complete. Haywads Heath Rugby Club have won the race in the past and so have St Peters Parochial Church Council. After the race, hundreds of people come to the big fete with sideshows,games,stalls,displays
